content:
Posted: October 21, 2013
												A part of the first season of Sam and Max point-and-click adventure game, the fourth episode is avaliable in Steam for free for you to try out.Sam and Max is usual adventure game with humor, with most puzzles making sense... yet you are probably going to spend time guessing what exactly you are supposed to do, like in most games if such kinds. Hell, single episode there may last for few hours if you have no idea what to do, or you may just get stuck if you never had experience playing adventure games before.As for the episode that is given to us, I can say that it has quite interesting concept/idea in this one, being related around Politics theme, first objective being punching president out of hypnotism, with more to come after that (with some nice music... tihi). It has enough content in it for me to say that you should try and beat this episode. Who knows, maybe you will like it enough to get the whole season pack?

There is one waf to tell for certain if you like the games, you could play this one. For the now cheap price of completley free you can play through Sam and Max: Able Lincoln Must Die to see if you like it. If you dont there is no harm done, if you do like it however there will be much harm done, atleast to your free time because you will be playing the Sam and Max series (maybe). So play this, afterall there is no harm in trying it.

Posted: February 5, 2011
												Back when individual episodes of Telltale Games' Sam & Max adventure games were for sale, they offered episode 4 of "season" 1 for free, presumably to draw in potential buyers. In my case, it worked.Episode 4 was probably a good choice, too. It has funny writing and pretty good puzzles for its season. Like the rest of the episodes, it's a staunchly traditional adventure game starring the wisecracking Freelance Police, and while it hasn't aged entirely gracefully in the looks department, it hits the difficulty sweet spot as such that when I first played it to completion, I didn't even need a walkthrough. (I used to be horrible at adventure games.)American patriots need not worry: you don't actually kill the real Abraham Lincoln in this game. His likeness does show up, though.

content:
Posted: September 1, 2015
												This game has great characters, dialogue, and the art style is a nice change of pace from other games. It's satyrical dialogue is wonderful and seperates it from the rest of the point-and-click style games that are out there. The only problem I have with the game is that the objectives seem fairly unrelated. This is my first Sam and Max game so maybe it's the style of the series that I'm missing, but the constant back-and-forth jumping between areas and activation of obscure points seem vaguely and loosely strung together. I fail to see the relationship between a decent amount of the objectives here. Not all of them- but more than a couple. Without a walkthrough I'd be lost in this. Other games in the genre at least have a box for obtaining more clues, I have yet to find this detail in the game but it'd definitely help. Like I said, maybe it's just me (the majority of reviews here are very positive) but this game doesn't feel as smooth as other Telltale games (i.e. Walking Dead, Back To The Future). I'm a fan of Telltale and everything else going on in the game, but I wouldn't recommend this one to a first-time player in this genre.

Posted: November 29, 2014



YouTube™ Video: Sam & Max : Abe Lincolm Must Die! - Max's  Elections Speech 

			Views: 10,722		

			Sam & Max : Abe Lincolm Must Die! - Max's Elections Speech		

One of the Best Episodes of Sam & Max Save the World aka Season 1 & a Personal Favorite of mine. In this Episode, Max gets to run for President of the United States & you get to blow up the Antarctic, The Kermlin, Krypton, BoscoTech's Store & Abe Lincoln himself! Be sure to Vote for everyone's favorite Lagomorph who represents the House of Random Acts of Violence & Destruction!Here's how I would solve the Problems with Toxic Waste: Free Home DeliveryHere's how I would describe the Tax Plans: Give Me All You GotAnd here's where I would stand on Education: 2 Wrongs don't make a Right, but 3 Lefts doYou get Sam & Max S1-EP4 for FREE via Telltale Games, Gametap or Steam & once you do, get ready for the GREATEST Election Day in Adventure Game History! It's Sam Vs. Lincoln in this Election Day Special Episode of Sam & Max Season 1: Sam & Max Save the World for the PC/Xbox 360's Xbox LIVE & Wii Consoles!

Posted: August 30, 2014
												Not sure what happened on this episode, but this is by far the worst one in the series.Unlike other bad point n' click adventure games, I enjoyed Sam & Max series because the puzzles were clever, funny and logical in a way the players would be able to figure out.However, towards the last part of the game, Sam & Max 104 suffers from random puzzle solutions that simply don't make sense, and the game requires the players to move from one visited location to the other visited location so often repeatedly on top of already terrible and slow controls.However, the humor was still present and aside from mentioned flaws teh game was enjoyable.

Yep it's free, go get your copy while it still is.( but I think it's free forever)On the other hand of me really liking this game, I tend to get peed off at how slow Sam & Max's walk cycle can be sometimes,Like when you're in a room or a smallish area and you click something that is a few feet away Sam and Max will takes their sweet old time getting there. It gets annoying sometime when you're on a roll figuring things out :-P. Kinda wish they had some module to speed up the walk cycle in options.All in all it's a pretty neat free download to checkout.Game Type: Point & Click AdventureDifficulty: Some puzzles are a bit difficult however very rewarding once solved.
